page.title: 19Oil production
page.content: Near Weston, there is an oil extraction unit known colloquially as a{Nodding Donkey.}It is owned by B.P. and is one of several onshore units in the region. A vertically drilled shaft is tapping the same underground source as other units, from a depth of about{1200m.}All units are linked to a gathering tank from where the oil is sent to a refinery. The units produce a{light oil}of 40 deg. A.P.I. grade, which is low in gas content, and refines to{ethylene, aviation fuels and{distillates. } E. Midlands production is approx. 2000 barrels/day, increasing to 3000 by the end of '85.(National onshore production is approx. 8500 barrels per day.) Britain has a reciprocal international agreement to exchange excess light oil for heavy oils, to supply other needs, such as bitumens.
